title: OnePlus 13 vs iQOO 13: Is spending ₹15,000 extra justified? - Hindustan Times
summary:
OnePlus 13 vs iQOO 13: Is spending ₹15,000 extra justified?

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Hindustan Times

This article compares the OnePlus 13 and iQOO 13, two flagship smartphones priced under ₹70,000, aiming to evaluate whether the higher cost of the OnePlus 13 is justified.

  • Both devices utilize Qualcomm's Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset.
  • The OnePlus 13 can have up to 1TB of storage and 24GB of RAM; the iQOO 13 is limited to 512GB and 16GB respectively.
  • The OnePlus 13 supports both wired and wireless charging; the iQOO 13 has faster wired charging but no wireless option.
  • Camera quality favors OnePlus 13 due to Hasselblad tuning, while both have triple-camera setups.
  • Software updates: OnePlus promises four years of OS updates and six years of security, while iQOO guarantees four OS upgrades and five years of security patches.
  • Pricing: OnePlus 13 at ₹69,999 vs iQOO 13 at ₹54,999, a difference of ₹15,000.
“If you prioritize camera performance, the OnePlus 13 is the clear winner. However, for value and gaming, the iQOO 13 is hard to beat.”

In conclusion, while the OnePlus 13 offers superior camera and build quality, the iQOO 13 presents a compelling value proposition for budget-conscious consumers.
newTitle: Comparing OnePlus 13 and iQOO 13: Is the Price Difference Worth It?

title: Noise launches Tag 1 object tracker compatible with Android, iOS: Details - Business Standard
summary:
Noise launches Tag 1 object tracker compatible with Android, iOS: Details

Last Updated: Jan 17 2025 | 5:12 PM IST | Source: Business Standard

Indian electronics brand Noise has launched its first object tracker, the Noise Tag 1, which is compatible with both Android and iOS devices.

  • The Noise Tag 1 is priced at Rs 1,499 and will be available starting January 28.
  • It integrates with Google’s Find My Device and Apple’s Find My Network for locating lost items.
  • Features include Ring Mode, Lost Mode, and Network Mode, which aid in finding misplaced items.
  • The device has a replaceable battery that lasts up to one year and is rated IPX4 for water resistance.
“Noise Tag 1 offers various modes for locating lost items, ensuring users can find their valuables with ease.”

This launch marks a significant step for Noise into the smart tracking market, positioning them alongside competitors like Reliance Jio.
newTitle: Noise Launches Affordable Object Tracker Compatible with Android and iOS

title: Apple hits pause on AI notification summaries for news in iOS 18.3 after accuracy complaints - CNBCTV18
summary:
Apple hits pause on AI notification summaries for news in iOS 18.3 after accuracy complaints

Date: Jan 17, 2025
Source: CNBC TV18

Apple has temporarily disabled its AI-driven news notification summaries in iOS 18.3 after receiving complaints about inaccuracies from sources like BBC News. The tech giant plans to refine the feature for a future update.

  • Apple's iOS 18.3 update includes changes to its Intelligence Notification Summaries feature.
  • Notifications for News and Entertainment apps have been temporarily disabled.
  • The move comes after complaints that summaries pulled inaccurate or misleading information.
  • Notification Summaries will still be available for non-news apps.
  • A warning in Settings now indicates the feature is still in beta.
  • Summarised text appears in italics for clearer differentiation.
“Apple acknowledged the issue and promised to refine the feature, with plans to bring back news summaries in a future update.”

This update highlights Apple's effort to address user concerns about misinformation in its notification summaries.
newTitle: Apple pauses AI news summaries in iOS 18.3 due to accuracy issues

title: Xiaomi Pad 7 review in 10 points - India Today
summary:
Xiaomi Pad 7 Review: 10 Key Highlights

Date: January 2025 | Source: India Today

The Xiaomi Pad 7 is a versatile Android tablet priced below Rs 30,000 that combines performance with a sleek design. It is aimed at consumers looking for an affordable yet high-quality tablet solution.

  • Lightweight at just 500g and 6.18mm thin, enhancing portability.
  • 11.2-inch LCD display offering 3.2K resolution and 144Hz refresh rate.
  • Powered by Snapdragon 7+ Gen 3 chipset with up to 12GB RAM.
  • Features HyperOS 2 for a clean interface and productivity tools.
  • Quad speakers with Dolby Atmos for an immersive audio experience.
  • 8,850mAh battery with 7 hours of usage and 45W fast charging.
  • Equipped with a 13MP rear camera and an ultra-wide front camera for video calls.
  • Supports accessories like the Focus Keyboard and Pen at an extra cost.
  • Start price of Rs 26,999 with a more premium option available at Rs 31,999.
  • Excellent choice for budget-conscious buyers.
“If you are planning to buy an Android tablet under Rs 30,000 then Xiaomi’s latest Pad 7 needs all your attention.”

In summary, the Xiaomi Pad 7 provides strong performance and a lightweight design, making it a commendable option for budget tablet seekers.
newTitle: Xiaomi Pad 7 Review: 10 Key Highlights

title: Apple Made AI Mistakes? Media Uproar Forces Tech Giant to Suspend 'AI News Feature' - Outlook Business
summary:
Apple Suspends AI News Feature Due to Media Backlash

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: Outlook Business

Apple has temporarily suspended its AI news feature after backlash from media organizations over frequent inaccuracies in its news summaries.

  • The feature previously rolled out for iPhone 16 and select iPads and Macs.
  • It generated incorrect notifications regarding news events, including a false report about a murder suspect.
  • The BBC and other media outlets expressed serious concerns over the inaccuracies and trust issues.
  • The National Union of Journalists called for immediate removal of the feature to prevent misinformation.
  • Apple plans to implement a software update to address these issues in the future.
“It is essential to us that our audiences can trust any information or journalism published in our name and that includes notifications” - BBC

The negative press and user complaints have led Apple to pause the feature while it works on improvements to ensure reliability in its news alerts.
newTitle: Apple Suspends AI News Feature Due to Media Backlash

title: Apple disables AI summaries for news temporarily - The Hindu
summary:
Apple Disables AI Summaries for News Temporarily

Date: January 17, 2025 Source: The Hindu

Apple has temporarily paused its AI news summary feature after multiple complaints of inaccurate headlines, deactivating it on iOS 18.3, iPadOS 18.3, and macOS Sequoia 15.3 betas.

  • The pause was prompted by complaints from BBC and other news outlets regarding false reports.
  • In December, a false notification claimed that a suspect charged with the death of a CEO shot himself.
  • In November, a notification incorrectly stated that Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu had been arrested.
  • Recent summaries involving WSJ journalist notifications were also inaccurate.
  • Apple plans to improve and reintroduce the feature in the future, alongside an updated notification style.
  • Users will have more control over these notifications, including the ability to toggle them directly from the lock screen.
"Apple plans to improve the feature and then release it again in the future."

The temporary suspension reflects Apple's commitment to accuracy and user control in news reporting features.
newTitle: Apple Disables AI Summaries for News Temporarily
